main event: Personnel at Osan Air Force Base in Korea reported sighting an unidentified flying object on the evening of September 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was first observed approximately 20 degrees above the horizon and 15 degrees west of north.
The object appeared to be spherical in shape and emitted a bright light.
It moved in an erratic manner, first slowly to the east-northeast, then rapidly to the west, and then back to the east-northeast before climbing at a very steep angle and disappearing.
Ground radar could not track the object, suggesting it was not a real target.
The object's behavior, such as rapid changes in altitude and speed, as well as color changes, could not be readily explained by any known conventional aircraft, satellite, or natural phenomena.
